Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • Card

  • public class Card
extends Object
    The Card class simulates a playing card, which can be assigned a rank and a suit; however, the card cannot be changed once initialized. The class includes methods for getting the suit or rank of a card, or whether or not it is facing up, as well as for comparing two cards.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card(int suit,
    int rank)
        This constructor sets the card's suit and rank to the integer values passed in as arguments.
        Parameters:
        suit - The card's suit.
        rank - The card's rank.

      • Card

        public Card(Card other)
        This copy constructor accepts another Card object passed in as an argument. It then sets the fields of the Card to those of the Card passed in.
        Parameters:
        other - The Card object to be copied.

    • Method Detail

      • setSuit

        public void setSuit(String s)
        The setSuit method takes a string passed in as an argument, then sets the suit field based on that string. If the string is not a valid suit, simply sets it to spades.
        Parameters:
        s - The string that the suit field will be set with.

      • setSuit

        public void setSuit(int s)
        This setSuit method takes an integer passed in as an argument and sets the suit field based on its value. If it is not a number from 1 to 4, simply sets the suit field to 1, or spades.
        Parameters:
        s - The value that the suit field will be set with.

      • setRank

        public void setRank(int r)
        The setRank method accepts an integer passed in as an argument, then sets the rank field based upon its value. If it is a number below 0 or over 13, simply sets it to 1, or an ace.
        Parameters:
        r - The value the rank field will be set with.

      • setRank

        public void setRank(String r)
        This setRank method accepts a string passed in as an argument, then converts it to an integer or looks at the card name it holds and sets the rank field based on its value. If it is not a valid card rank, simply sets it to an ace.
        Parameters:
        r - The string that the rank field will be set with.

      • setFaceUp

        public void setFaceUp(boolean f)
        The setFaceUp method accepts a boolean as an argument and sets the faceUp field based on its value.
        Parameters:
        f - The boolean that the faceUp field will be set to.

      • getSuit

        public int getSuit()
        The getSuit method returns the value held in the object's suit field.
        Returns:
        The value the suit variable contains.

      • getRank

        public int getRank()
        The getRank method returns the value held in the object's rank field.
        Returns:
        The value the rank variable contains.

      • getFaceUp

        public boolean getFaceUp()
        The getFaceUp method returns the boolean value held in the object's faceUp field.
        Returns:
        The value the faceUp variable contains.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        The toString method gets the current state of the Card object and returns it as a string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        The Card object's current state.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Card otherCard)
        The equals method accepts a Card object passed in as an argument and compares the two objects' suits and ranks. If they are equal, it returns true. Otherwise, it returns false.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the two objects are equal.
